result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph C Curtis

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph C Curtis appeared by video.  Attorney Vincent Joseph Bobot appeared by video for Joseph C Curtis.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. Defendant requests additional time to retain a different lawyer. Court adjourns matter for a status of counsel hearing in Branch 29.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph C Curtis appeared by video.  Attorney Vincent Joseph Bobot in court for Joseph C Curtis.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a final pre-trial. Defense counsel filed a motion to withdraw and advises the Court defendant wants to privately retain a different attorney. Court takes motion under advisement and sets matter for a status of counsel hearing. Court cancels the jury trial on 10/10/22. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Witness List, received and filed

Defendant Joseph C Curtis appeared by video.  Attorney Vincent Joseph Bobot appeared by video for Joseph C Curtis.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a final pre-trial. Defense counsel requests an adjournment of the jury trial on 10/10/22. Any documents and/or motions to be filed no later than 48 hours before the final pre-trial. Court sets matter for an adjourned final pre-trial in Branch 29.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Motions in Limine, received and filed.

OFF THE RECORD- Defendant Joseph C Curtis in court with attorney Vincent Joseph Bobot.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph C Curtis in court with attorney Vincent Joseph Bobot.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail/bond hearing held. Defense counsel requests the no contact order be modified. State objects. Court DENIES the request. Defense counsel requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph C Curtis in court with attorney Vincent Joseph Bobot.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel has discovery from the State. Defense counsel requests a bail/bond hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph C Curtis in court with attorney Vincent Joseph Bobot.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pre-trial conference held.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel needs discovery and an offer from the State and requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 03/31/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JAP.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Joseph C Curtis in court with attorney Vincent Joseph Bobot.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 29.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/29/22 @ 2p
